bug.short_desc: firefox 4 will not close out of window processes

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
when I go to close firefox 4, the program will close. I will then go to reopen firefox browser and I will get the statement "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. To open a new window, you must fist close the existing Firefox process, or restart your system"
from this point I have to click control / alt / delete and go to the task manager to close the firefox process. What a couple of seconds and then restart the program.
Unfortunately this is becoming very annoying. An issue I have not had with the 3.6 build. This only started with the upgrade to 4.0.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.doens't happen every time, but would say 3 out of 5 times 2. 3.
I would like an email back to dlschwerin@bex.net that this has been received.

Does the issue occur in Safe Mode? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/Safe+Mode
This is usually caused by an extensions preventing Firefox from closing properly.
